trustfund:
TF023354-REPUBLIC OF GHANA -- SECOND
            ECONOMIC REFORM SUPPORT OPERATIO

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Economic Reform Support
            Operation Credit Project for Ghana seeks to consolidate
            recent gains in restoring macroeconomic stability and will
            support the implementation of a deeper phase of the reform
            program in the cocoa, energy, and banking sectors. Fiscal
            policies supported under the credit improve fiscal
            sustainability while raising the efficiency of resource
            mobilization and use. In particular, the termination of
            specific road contracts removes an important source of
            fiscal imbalance and resource misallocation. Also,
            eliminating the "special tax" on imports begins a
            process to further rationalize the import tariff regime so
            as to provide adequate incentives to local industry within a
            regional context. Very importantly, the Credit will
            implement a revised strategy for the cocoa sector developed
            with strong stakeholder ownership. As part of this strategy,
            the increase in the farmers' share of the fob price
            will be further accelerated while external marketing will be
            gradually opened to private competition. The Credit
            implements key elements of the remaining reform agenda by
            establishing market regulations, divesting the distribution
            units of Ghana's electric company, enhancing financial
            system soundness by targeting the closure of distressed
            banks, and continuing the divestiture of the remaining
            government banks. The Credit helps cover Ghana's
            external financing requirements while it assists in reducing
            the government's domestic financing requirements.
